p: A recent study [ 163] reported that daily administration of 200 mg/kg of the ethanolic extract of C. longa to endometriosis rat models decreased the oxidative stress. After the administration of the ethanolic extracts, the activity of SOD, CAT, and GPx significantly increased, while plasma MDA was lowered. Furthermore, according to Kuo et al. [ 164], C. longa regulated the expression of COX-2, iNOS, CAT, and NO, exerting both anti-oxidative and anti-inflammatory effects.
